titleStmt.title: To DAVID ROBERTS,David Roberts, RA (1796-1864; Dictionary of National Biography), painter. Travelled widely in Europe, Egypt and Syria, publishing works with his topographical illustrations. He had probably met CD through Stanfield. See further Pilgrim Letters 5, p. 522, n.4. 11 DECEMBER 1859

dateline.placeName: TAVISTOCK HOUSE | TAVISTOCK SQUARE, LONDON. W.C.

body.p: Forster is not asked. I had no idea there was anything amiss between you,The cause of the misunderstanding not discovered, though Forster was famously rebarbative. CD had already touched on this rift (To Roberts, 30 Nov 59). but it happens that he is not one of the party, and that it all falls out right.
